Detailed Description

The EventController handles events and calls the appropriate callbacks when the occur.

The callback functions are REQUIRED to be enclosed in class instances since the class instance (usually the module) is used to track which events are related so that they ca be freed when the module is unloaded

Member Function Documentation

def controllers.eventcontroller.EventController.release_related (   self,
  obj 
)

Release callbacks registered by a module.

Parameters:
obj Module instance for which callbacks should be released
Warning:
This should NEVER be called directly by a module

def controllers.eventcontroller.EventController.register_timer (   self,
  callback,
  interval,
  args = (),
  kwargs = {} 
)

Run a specified function after a specified time.

Parameters:
callback Function to call
interval Time to wait before calling the callback function
args (Optional) Tuple containing arguments in the order they should be passed
kwargs (Optional) Dict containing named arguments to pass to the callback

def controllers.eventcontroller.EventController.register_command (   self,
  command,
  callback,
  privileged = False 
)

Register command callback.

Parameters:
command Command excluding command prefix. Example: "mycommand"
callback Function to execute when this command is dispatched
privileged Whether or not the command is privileged or not and subject to ACL
Note:
 Callback functions should have the form
 def callback(ModuleInterface, params)
 Where params will be the parameters of the command. Example: "!mycommand param1 param2 param3" will yield "param1 param2 param3"

def controllers.eventcontroller.EventController.get_command_callbacks (   self,
  command 
)

Retrieve all callbacks associated with a command.

Parameters:
command Command to find associated callbacks for
Returns:
List of tuples (classinstance, callback, privileged?)

def controllers.eventcontroller.EventController.register_event (   self,
  event,
  callback 
)

Register event callback Register callback for an IRC-event, this could be any command the server sends, including numerics.

Parameters:
callback Function to execute when this event is dispatched
event Event to register. Example: "PRIVMSG", "PART", "QUIT", "001"
Note:
 Callback functions should have the form
 def callback(IRCMessageController)

  callback

Register a system event callback.

Parameters:
event Event code
callback Callback function to receive the event
